critique: The document focuses on the dissemination of scientific and industrial information obtained from enemy countries after World War II. It aims to make this information publicly available while ensuring national military security. There is a balance between transparency and security concerns, with the Secretary of War and Secretary of the Navy retaining the power to restrict information release if it compromises national security. The order also extends the authority of the Director of War Mobilization and Reconversion and the Publication Board to handle this information.
